summary:
+ Vice President - Corporate Credit Management - Global Banking Corporate Coverage - Technology sector - BNP Paribas San Francisco

- Reviewed financial information from the client, conducted financial spreading of audited statements which was supplemented with industry reports and external ratings to arrive at final credit risk rating for corporate clients.
- Conducted complex credit analysis including projection modeling; presented written reports detailing the financial position and cash flow of the client, potential risks, collateral position, key strengths, and weaknesses
- Provided timely and detailed recommendations for credit structure, risk rating, pricing and credit approval in line with bank's quality standards and internal policies
- Enabled Senior RM to ensure credit, financial crime risk and operational risk elements of the portfolio are managed to highest standards
- Credit Risk Management - Keenly monitored the portfolio to address security deficiencies and pro-actively identified accounts with deteriorating credit quality at an early stage to minimize/mitigate default losses. Submitted annual credit reviews, credit amendments requests and waiver requests seeking dispensations from Bank policies as appropriate.
- Financial Crime Risk Management – Completed KYC and periodic client due diligence on ultimate beneficial owners, transactional activity, geographical exposure of clients to mitigate Money Laundering & Sanctions Risk
- Operations Risk Management – Adhered to strict operational controls set by Bank's Policy to identify and escalate operational incidents
- Diligently completed credit requests & pro-actively monitored the portfolio through covenant testing and overdue report analysis to highlight any credit concerns.
